intro: Lomaria gibba, commonly known as the spurred bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive spurred petals. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are bell-shaped and range in color from blue to purple, attracting various pollinators. Lomaria gibba is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
